conclusion: Analyze given information and use physics principles to determine coefficients of kinetic friction and mass of object A.
Objects A and B are stacked on a smooth horizontal surface, and a horizontal force F is applied to object A.
Gravitational acceleration g is given as 10 m/s².
Graph shows relationship between acceleration a and force F.
Identify forces: Force F, Gravitational Force G, Normal Force N, Coefficient of Kinetic Friction μ_k.
Apply Newton's Second Law: Net Force F_net is sum of all forces acting on object A.
Equation of motion: F_net = ma, where m is mass of object A.
Calculate acceleration a: a = F_net/m = F/m.
Determine coefficient of kinetic friction μ_k: a = F/m = F/m * g/μ_k, leading to μ_k = g/a.
Determine mass of object A m: a = F/m = F/m * g/μ_k, leading to m = F/(a * μ_k).
Calculate acceleration a from graph: acceleration a increases linearly with force F, slope of graph is 8 m/s²/N.
Determine coefficient of kinetic friction μ_k: μ_k = g/a = 10 m/s² / 8 m/s²/N = 1.25 N/m.
Determine mass of object A m: m = F/(a * μ_k) = 60 N / (8 m/s² * 1.25 N/m) = 5 kg.
Conclusion: Coefficient of kinetic friction μ_k is 1.25 N/m, mass of object A is 5 kg.
